cards.question: Open your console log.  Find the object's fifth index.  What is the name of the pokemon inside?
What is JSON?
cards.answer: JavaScript Object Notation. JSON is a minimal, readable format for structuring data. It is used primarily to transmit data between a server and web application, as an alternative to XML.

cards.question: What do AJAX requests do?
cards.answer: They query data asynchronously with your app performing in the background.

cards.question: What is the minimum datatype needed for an AJAX request?
What is url?
cards.answer: A uniform resource locator (URL) is the address of a resource on the Internet. A URL indicates the location of a resource as well as the protocol used to access it.

cards.question: What is http?
cards.answer: Stands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol. HTTP is the protocol used to transfer data over the web. It is part of the Internet protocol suite and defines commands and services used for transmitting webpage data. HTTP uses a server-client model

cards.question: What is https?
cards.answer: Hyper Text Transfer Protocol Secure (HTTPS) is the secure version of HTTP, the protocol over which data is sent between your browser and the website that you are connected to.

cards.question: What does the (document).ready() function do?
cards.answer: Function runs all of code inside of it once our page has finished loading.

cards.question: Every page on the internet is stored...where?
what do engineers use to develop websites before releasing them to the public?
What happens when you type www.facebook.com into your browser? and when your browser receives the response? What is the API in this case
cards.answer: A request goes out to Facebook's remote server. Once your browser receives the response, it interprets the code and displays the page. To the browser, also known as the client, Facebook's server is an API.

cards.question: How does API differ from remote server?
cards.answer: An API isn't the same as the remote server â€” rather it is the part of the server that receives requests and sends responses.

cards.question: True or False: Every time you visit a page on the Web, you interact with some remote server's API
GET request
cards.answer: An internet request for data. Sent from a client to a server.

cards.question: Response
cards.answer: A server's response to a request. Sent from a server to a client. A response to a GET request will usually include data that the client needs to load the page's content.

cards.question: requesting asynchronously
cards.answer: means that requests/responses can happen in the background without blocking the rest of the page load

cards.question: callback
cards.answer: instructions that I can do something with when I get a response back; call on instructions when I get a response back

cards.question: What is API?
cards.answer: Application Programming Interface. Tools computers use to communicate with each other
